question: Planning by a supervisor involves setting ________ targets and organizing work for efficient completion.
Supervisors create a work plan by understanding company ________.
Supervisors break down goals into small ________ to ensure tasks are manageable.
Supervisors assign work to employees and ensure ________ are met.
Supervisors solve problems that arise during work, such as handling an absent ________.
The focus of supervisory planning is usually ________.
Supervisors focus on getting things done, ensuring that employees understand their ________.
Planning ensures that tools, materials, and workforce are used ________.
Supervisors ensure that all employees work together ________.
If issues arise, supervisors adjust plans accordingly, which is part of ________ planning.
Supervisors create work schedules to assign duties to employees and ensure work is completed on ________.
Supervisors must plan how to use available materials, tools, and employees ________.
Some tasks are more urgent than others. A supervisor prioritizes work to ensure that the most important tasks are done ________.
Supervisors plan work shifts, ensuring that there are enough workers at any given ________.
If an issue arises, supervisors must quickly adjust the plan. This includes handling employee absences, equipment failure, or urgent client ________.
Planning by a supervisor is important because it ________ productivity.
Proper planning prevents waste of time, money, and ________.
Effective planning ensures that deadlines are met, and work does not pile ________.
Planning minimizes confusion by ensuring employees know their ________.
Well-planned work ensures fair work distribution, keeping employees ________.
